newsitem.title: INDONESIA: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - Oct 22.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - Oct 22.

text.p: The following are the leading stories in the Indonesian press on Oct 21. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy. Telephone: (6221) 384-6364. Fax: (6221) 344-8404.
Indonesian Foreign Minister Ali Alatas says donations by Indonesian businessman James Riady to the U.S. Democratic Party were a private matter in which Jakarta had no involvement.

Indonesia's Coordinating Minister for Production and Distribution Hartarto told the Organisation of Islamic Conference (OIC) that it should focus more on economic cooperation rather than political issues to promote the welfare of Islamic countries.

Retired army general and former Interior Minister Rudini has called for the ruling Golkar party to prepare five candidates for the post of president and vice-president ahead of the 1998 presidential election.
Police have denied a key suspect and witness in a toll-road robbery died in custody after being detained.
Foreign contractors have been released from the list of negative investment allowing them to join the Indonesian Construction Association (Gapensi) and enter the construction sector.
Sampoerna Investment Corporation will soon sell 33 million shares in PT Astra International as the company had only planned to make a short term investment, company officials said.
